lists.title: FOURTH WING
lists.author: Rebecca Yarros
lists.description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

lists.title: ASSISTANT TO THE VILLAIN
lists.author: Hannah Nicole Maehrer
lists.description: Evie Sage gets a job doing unspecified office duties for the most infamous villain in the kingdom of Rennedawn.

lists.title: TOM LAKE
lists.author: Ann Patchett
lists.description: Three daughters, who return to their family orchard in the spring of 2020, learn about their mother's relationship with a famous actor.

lists.title: THE COWORKER
lists.author: Freida McFadden
lists.description: After an accountant is murdered, a sales rep at a nutritional supplement company gets caught in a game of cat and mouse.

lists.title: THE BREAKAWAY
lists.author: Jennifer Weiner
lists.description: As her wedding to a man she met at a childhood weight-loss camp approaches, Abby goes on a cycling trip to Niagara Falls in a group that includes an old fling.

lists.title: THE HOUSEMAID
lists.author: Freida McFadden
lists.description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

lists.title: TOO LATE
lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: Dangers develop when a drug trafficker becomes obsessed with a woman who has a mutual attraction to a D.E.A. agent.

lists.title: THE GIRL IN THE EAGLE'S TALONS
lists.author: Karin Smirnoff
lists.description: The seventh book in the Girl With the Dragon Tattoo series. When violence disrupts Mikael Blomkvist's daughter's marriage, Lisbeth Salander appears to be his last hope.

lists.title: IT ENDS WITH US
lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

lists.title: LESSONS IN CHEMISTRY
lists.author: Bonnie Garmus
lists.description: A scientist and single mother living in California in the 1960s becomes a star on a TV cooking show.

lists.title: THE COVENANT OF WATER
lists.author: Abraham Verghese
lists.description: Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning.

lists.title: DEMON COPPERHEAD
lists.author: Barbara Kingsolver
lists.description: Winner of a 2023 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. A reimagining of Charles Dickens’s “David Copperfield” set in the mountains of southern Appalachia.

lists.title: THE HEAVEN & EARTH GROCERY STORE
lists.author: James McBride
lists.description: Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well.

lists.title: VERITY
lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: Lowen Ashleigh is hired by the husband of an injured writer to complete her popular series and uncovers a horrifying truth.

lists.title: IT STARTS WITH US
lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: In the sequel to “It Ends With Us,” Lily deals with her jealous ex-husband as she reconnects with her first boyfriend.

lists.title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON
lists.author: David Grann
lists.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil.

lists.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
lists.author: Bessel van der Kolk
lists.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

lists.title: OUTLIVE
lists.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
lists.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
lists.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

lists.title: AMERICAN PROMETHEUS
lists.author: Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin
lists.contributor: by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin
lists.description: A biography of J. Robert Oppenheimer. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize in 2006 and an inspiration for the film “Oppenheimer.”

lists.title: THE WAGER
lists.author: David Grann
lists.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.

lists.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED
lists.author: Jennette McCurdy
lists.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.

lists.title: GAMBLER
lists.author: Billy Walters with Armen Keteyian
lists.contributor: by Billy Walters with Armen Keteyian
lists.description: The sports gambler shares his life story and gives insights on his betting system.

lists.title: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS
lists.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
lists.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.

lists.title: AN IMMENSE WORLD
lists.author: Ed Yong
lists.description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning science writer explains the sensory perceptions and ways of communication used by a variety of animals.

lists.title: CRYING IN H MART
lists.author: Michelle Zauner
lists.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.
